intro: Schizonephros glaucescens, commonly known as the blue-leafed schizonephros, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae, which includes roses and other related species. The plant is characterized by its glaucous, waxy leaves that give it a distinctive blue-green appearance. It produces small, white to pink flowers that bloom in spring. Schizonephros glaucescens is often found in rocky or forested habitats at high elevations.
